name: Yevgeniy Dodis
content: Yevgeniy Dodis, Academic Home Page Yevgeniy Dodis Professor, IACR Fellow. Cryptography Group Department of Computer Science Courant Institute of Mathematical Sciences New York University Publications | CV | Advising | Teaching | Professional | Contact | Miscellaneous My main interests are in Cryptography; especially Leakage-Resilient Cryptography Random Number Generation Cryptography with Biometrics and Other Noisy Data Hash Functions and Random Oracle Model Information-Theoretic Cryptography Secure (Group) Messaging More generally, I'm interested in Theoretical Computer Science at large (Algorithms, Complexity, Combinatorics, etc.). Publications Research Papers (in reverse chronological order) Surveys, Book Chapters, Thesis, etc. DBLP, Google Citation, Crypto/Eurocrypt/TCC (all-time stats). Some impementations: Generic Signal Messaging Protocol (by Yi Tang) Efficiency Comparisons for MLS variants (by Yi Tang) Implementation of secure skecthes (by Leonid Reyzin) I was also a contributor to Ron Rivestâ€™s MD6 effort Curriculum Vitae (check the date at the end) Short Biographical Sketch 2021 IACR Test of Time Award for our work on verifiable random functions (ceremony). 2020 IACR Fellow (ceremony). "For fundamental contributions to cryptology, especially to cryptographic randomness and symmetric-key primitives, and for service to the IACR". Inreview about recents trends in Secuirty and Privacy for DIGITALAX Magazine. One-on-one 30-minute interview on Randomness and Coincidence for the "Science goes to the movies" TV series. Courant newsletter about my work on Randomness in Cryptography. 2019 IACR Test of Time Award for our work on fuzzy extractors (ceremony). Facebook award on "Secure the Internet" for my work on Encrypted messaging. Short interview on NBC News about the use of encrypted technology by terrorists. Daily Texan article about random number generation covering some of my work.
